name: fabricating
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
fabricate
to invent or produce something false in order to deceive someone: He was late, so he fabricated an excuse to avoid trouble. He claims that the police fabricated evidence against him.
especially US to produce a product, especially in an industrial process: The company fabricates and sells steel. An electronic circuit is fabricated on a silicon wafer.
